metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24728 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: CKEditor4 is an open source what-you-see-is-what-you-get HTML editor. A vulnerability has been discovered in the core HTML processing module and may affect all plugins used by CKEditor 4 prior to version 4.18.0. The vulnerability allows someone to inject malformed HTML bypassing content sanitization, which could result in executing JavaScript code. This problem has been patched in version 4.18.0. There are currently no known workarounds.

notes.Note: sbeattie> embedded copies of ckeditor are in ldap-account-manager, rt4, and rt5

criterions.comment: ckeditor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ckeditor3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ldap-account-manager: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
request-tracker4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
